A number of these I noticed. Tried to keep the scope as limited as possible to avoid getting too deep and mixing too many different kinds of changes in.

This update resulted in:
Step 'google-java-format' found problem in 'game-core/src/main/java/games/strategy/triplea/delegate/Matches.java':

The inline suggestion is nice, though I think we probably should reserve it for quick typos. This PR is really risky for scope creep, there are tons of follow on simplifications that should be done.

Needed a missing close paren.
I like the change, but it's not for this PR. I don't like how the indentation is updated and increases the diff pretty drastically. Collapsing methods from Matches into TripleAPlayer was arguably too far of an update as well. With that the focus is really just on the one change at a time.

Off-Topic:
I really don't quite get why we're using BigDecimal for movement.
I'm pretty sure double would be precise enough for TripleA
Well in this case there's no point to use the surrounding Comparator.comparing, just return the lambda directly I'd say
Agree, updated in: a82b983

Going to shy away from this update, there are many more updates we can do. This line is only swapping the casted type, I do not want to do more than just that (it opens up the flood gates, in which case such a giant update is unlikely to be accurate, let alone complete or reviewable)

@ron-murhammer You might have any insight here.
Is it important that movement left is rounded to an  int before comparing units?
Otherwise it would be simpler writing something like
Comparator.comparing(Unit::getMovementLeft)
I think this change was unintended

This is a good catch @RoiEXLab 👍
An example of me going slightly too far in simplifications.
Fixed in: 278da46
Actually fixed in: 7d7174d
